channel.title: VNA on James Horton
channel.description: Recent content in VNA on James Horton

item.title: Filter Testing
item.description: This post is going to take a look at some Filters that I have “made at home”, for when I am experimenting with my Software Defined Radio’s. The filters are for use in the 433MHz band, and I wanted to create some bandpass filters to improve the IQ Recordings I was making, as I was getting a lot of out of band interference on my Pluto SDR. For a 433MHz Filter I could have just purchased some pre-made boards, complete with some simple filters on ebay, there were plenty of options but they all seemed a little expensive, so what harm is there in just having a look at trying to build something myself.
